chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K
k: AbsRing.sort K

Goal:
(forall n m : K, mult n m = mult m n) -> is_linear (fun x : V => scal k x)

Premises:
Notation AbsRing := AbsRing
scal = fun (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K) => ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : forall (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K), K -> V -> V Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted
Record is_linear (K : AbsRing) (U V : NormedModule K) (l : U -> V) : Prop := Build_is_linear { linear_plus : forall x y : U, l (plus x y) = plus (l x) (l y); linear_scal : forall (k : K) (x : U), l (scal k x) = scal k (l x); linear_norm : exists M : R, 0 < M /\ (forall x : U, norm (l x) <= M * norm x) } For is_linear: Arguments K, U, V are implicit and maximally inserted For Build_is_linear: Arguments K, U, V are implicit and maximally inserted For is_linear: Argument scopes are [_ _ _ function_scope] For Build_is_linear: Argument scopes are [_ _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope _]
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
mult = fun K : Ring => Ring.mult (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K -> K -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
AbelianGroup.sort = fun t : AbelianGroup => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbelianGroup -> Type AbelianGroup.sort is a coercion
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : Z => (m + - n)%Z : Z -> Z -> Z Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
abs_pow_n : forall (x : ?K) (n : nat), abs (pow_n x n) <= abs x ^ n where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing]
ModuleSpace.ax1 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u) = ModuleSpace.scal K V m (mult x y) u
NormedModule.ax1 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x y : V), NormedModule.norm K V m (plus x y) <= NormedModule.norm K V m x + NormedModule.norm K V m y
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y
NormedModule.ax4 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x y : V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> NormedModule.norm K V m (minus y x) < NormedModule.norm_factor K V m * eps
equiv_scal : forall (f g : ?T -> ?V) (c : ?K), (exists y : ?K, mult y c = one) -> is_equiv ?F f g -> is_equiv ?F (fun x : ?T => scal c (f x)) (fun x : ?T => scal c (g x)) where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Filter ?F]
NormedModule.ax2 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (l : K) (x : V), NormedModule.norm K V m (scal l x) <= abs l * NormedModule.norm K V m x
mult_assoc : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Ring]
continuous_mult : forall (f g : ?U -> ?K) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous g x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => mult (f y) (g y)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing]
AbsRing.ax5 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x : K), AbsRing.abs K m x = 0 -> x = zero
IZR = fun z : Z => match z with | 0%Z => R0 | Z.pos n => IPR n | Z.neg n => - IPR n end : Z -> R Argument scope is [Z_scope]
NormedModule.ax5 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x : V), NormedModule.norm K V m x = 0 -> x = zero
mult_one_l : forall x : ?K, mult one x = x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Ring]
is_linear_scal_l : forall x : V, is_linear (fun k : K => scal k x)
is_linear_ext : forall l1 l2 : ?U -> ?V, (forall x : ?U, l1 x = l2 x) -> is_linear l1 -> is_linear l2 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_linear_comp : forall (l1 : ?U -> ?V) (l2 : ?V -> ?W), is_linear l1 -> is_linear l2 -> is_linear (fun x : ?U => l2 (l1 x)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?W : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
domin_scal_l : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (g : ?T -> ?V) (c : ?Ku), (exists y : ?Ku, mult y c = one) -> is_domin ?F f g ->...-> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_mult : forall x y : ?K, filterlim (fun z : ?K * ?K => mult (fst z) (snd z)) (filter_prod (locally x) (locally y)) (locally (mult x y)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing]
Build_is_linear : forall l : ?U -> ?V, (forall x y : ?U, l (plus x y) = plus (l x) (l y)) -> (forall (k0 : ?K) (x : ?U), l (scal k0 x) = scal k0 (l x)) -> (exists M : R, 0 < M /\ (forall x : ?U, norm (l x) <= M * norm x)) -> is_linear l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
NormedModule.ax3 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x y : V) (eps : R), NormedModule.norm K V m (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y
mult_distr_l : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Ring]
mult_distr_r : forall x y z : ?K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- Ring]
continuous_scal : forall (k0 : ?U -> ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U), continuous k0 x -> continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal (k0 y) (f y)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_scal_l : forall (f : ?U -> ?K) (k0 : ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal (f y) k0) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_scal_r : forall (k0 : ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal k0 (f y)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
AbsRing.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (abs : K -> R), abs zero = 0 -> abs (opp one) = 1 -> (forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y) -> (forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y) -> (forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero) -> AbsRing.mixin_of K
linear_norm : forall l : ?U -> ?V, is_linear l -> exists M : R, 0 < M /\ (forall x : ?U, norm (l x) <= M * norm x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K k : K |- NormedModule ?K]
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
